FlavorText: Flavor text...
Name: Work

ActionResult.FlavorText: I adjust my heading towards the volcanic planet of Deepmine.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: It's infernal surface, the smoky peaks and fiery chasms welcome you with indifference.
ActionResult.Title: Travel to Deepmine

ActionResult.FlavorText: I delve through crag and fire.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Inside the volcanic mountain, you find it's heart, a living flame.
ActionResult.Title: Explore Deepmine

FlavorText: With it's surface engulfed in flame and smoke, the only rule below is: don't ask what the creature beside you did to retreat here.
Name: Deepmine

ActionResult.FlavorText: There is little else to do but bend my back and put the flame to the tunnel.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You do the day's work, your hands and back sore. One can only endure so much...
ActionResult.Title: Toil in the Deepmines

ActionResult.FlavorText: There is little else to do but bend my back and put the flame to the tunnel.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: In the stretch of tunnel you've been assigned, you see a glint... a shimmer... what could it be?
ActionResult.Title: Toil in the Deepmines

FlavorText: As the contract binds, there is little else to do but bend my back and put the flame to the tunnel.
Name: Toil the Deep

FlavorText: Harken to that melodious sound of the clink of coin.
Name: Gold

ActionResult.FlavorText: Fate must be smiling at me.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Entombed in stone you find the skeleton of a small craft, by the laws of salvage it's yours to dream with.
ActionResult.Title: Excavating the Find

FlavorText: A shimmering glint embedded in the grasp of stone... This is going to take some work.
Name: Glint in the Wall

ActionResult.FlavorText: When did I stop dreaming? Was it when I entered this Hell? Was it before?
ActionResult.OutcomeText: With your surface time before bed, you gaze into space. Bringing the broken ship back to life and getting out of these mines is all that matters to you now.
ActionResult.Title: Dreaming of Freedom

ActionResult.FlavorText: I put my nose to the grinding bench, and install some of the parts.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: She's half done, you're almost there.
ActionResult.Title: Welding her Together

FlavorText: The remnants of someone else's dream, perhaps you can make it your own.
Name: Shattered Shuttle

FlavorText: The flaming heart of a fiery mountain, it's vibrant heat is intoxicating, and must be contained to be handled.
Name: Flaming Essence

ActionResult.FlavorText: I approach the shift supervisor to see to speak of Freedom.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: She suggests that you save to take a trip to Wreckage Bay. They might have what you need.
ActionResult.Title: To Speak of Freedom

ActionResult.FlavorText: I approach supervisor Uma, but I've already asked her about my dream.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: She greets you like she would any of the other scabs, but she does inquire as to whether or not you've moved up in the world.
ActionResult.Title: Talking to Uma

FlavorText: Shift Supervisor Uma, is as experienced a helldiver as they come. In the Deepmines, she's the person all the scabs look up to.
Name: Helldiver Uma

ActionResult.FlavorText: I ask Greyhound about Wreckage bay.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: He's willing to take you, holding out a hand for payment before he'll grant passage.
ActionResult.Title: Greyhound's Fare

ActionResult.FlavorText: Greyhound can take me where I want to go.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Passage requires payment.
ActionResult.Title: On Greyhound's Fare

ActionResult.FlavorText: I drop a coin into his hand.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: He gestures for you to follow. It doesn't take long.
ActionResult.Title: Paying For Passage

FlavorText: He can take you where you want to go, for a price, of course.
Name: Greyhound

ActionResult.FlavorText: The sheer amount of twisted metal that lay strewn about in this space between is awe inspiring.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You disembark and enter the salvage station.
ActionResult.Title: Travel to Wreckage Bay

ActionResult.FlavorText: I sift through miles of half salvaged ships.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You find one wreck as of yet untouched, it has something in it's cargo bay.
ActionResult.Title: Explore Wreckage Bay

FlavorText: The Buccaneer's bonyard, a veritable asteroid belt except without any asteroids, there's just a whole lot of stolen ships and ship parts floating around.
Name: Wreckage Bay

ActionResult.FlavorText: I inquire about ship parts, he gives a sickeningly wet and not quite toothy grin.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Delighted that you're in search of scraps. He informs you that if you have the gold, he's got the parts. If not, you can work... like a dog to save for what you need.
ActionResult.Title: On Table Scraps

ActionResult.FlavorText: I've have enough, time to continue my journey.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: He unceremoniously dumps a pile of components both mundane and magical on the table in front of you.
ActionResult.Title: Buying Ship Parts

ActionResult.FlavorText: Now that I'm with the Crimson, I decided to check in and see if there was any better salvage I could purchase.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: The Dogboy believes that with your current status he can supply you with frigate class components.
ActionResult.Title: Shopping as a Pirate

FlavorText: A ghoulish servant of greater sires, he takes delight in reminding those who darken his door that they are in search of... scraps.
Name: Dogboy

ActionResult.FlavorText: The plasma cutter arcs as you search for whatever might be of value.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: It's not much better then the toil of Deepmine, at least it isn't so damn hot.
ActionResult.Title: Slicing Salvage

FlavorText: Compensation can be had, for those willing to scour the ships of the dead.
Name: Salvage Scrap

ActionResult.FlavorText: Seeking to understand the manipulation of reality's component parts.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: This feeling evokes the memory of our ancient ancestors, banging rocks together to produce flame, thankfully we have manuals.
ActionResult.Title: Praying over Magic Wires

ActionResult.FlavorText: Seeking to understand the manipulation of reality's component parts.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: This evokes the memory of our ancient ancestors, banging rocks together to produce flame, thankfully we have manuals.
ActionResult.Title: Praying over Magic Wires

FlavorText: These look like a jumble of wires and witchy arcanery.
Name: Components

ActionResult.FlavorText: I insert the mechanism into it's place and twist.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Inside the Cryo Coffin, a man awakens.
ActionResult.Title: Inserting the Crypt Key

FlavorText: Vampiric Nobility make use of cryogenic freezing to both preserve themselves and to pass time without notice. This one is marked with the symbol of Clan Darkstar.
Name: Cryo Coffin

FlavorText: A retro-fitted meso-scaled energy supply, meant to power a demanding household appliance, will barely power a shuttle.
Name: Jolt Battery

ActionResult.FlavorText: I can barely believe it, I'm almost there.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You acquire you first ship.
ActionResult.Title: Applying Finishing Touches

FlavorText: The Wings of Liberty are halfway finished.
Name: Half Built Shuttle

FlavorText: A basic shuttle capable of carrying one to two passengers on short flights through the emptyness between.
Name: Shuttle

FlavorText: It's arcane matrix was designed after King Arthur's own legendary scabbard, able to protect against even some of the most powerful magical skullduggery.
Name: Pendragon Veil

FlavorText: A powerful laser array developed by the best magi of The White Lodge, named after Lancelot's own sword.
Name: Rays of Arondite

FlavorText: The ultimate weapon given to Arthur by the Lady of the Lake, remembered as the hope of mankind. Excalibur.
Name: Excalibur

ActionResult.FlavorText: I set out to explore the shadowy cloud.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You find a few locations of note.
ActionResult.Title: Explore the Dark Shroud

FlavorText: A dense interstellar cloud obscures this place, making it the place the ideal environment for Aristoratic Vampire Pirates to call home.
Name: Nocturne

ActionResult.FlavorText: I descend into depths unknown to mortal kind.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Before you go too far into the twisting paths, you find an opened vault, cleared of most it's contents an unassuming tome remains.
ActionResult.Title: Explore the Downward Spirals

ActionResult.FlavorText: I command my ship toward that darkest path of the veil, to the descending palace.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You disembark into the asteoid's interior, this place is quite posh actually.
ActionResult.Title: Travel to Castle Dracule

FlavorText: The dark prince's abode, a palatial fortress carved from an isolated asteroid. Tread lightly, for here Antediluvian's dwell.
Name: Dracule

ActionResult.FlavorText: I fly around the Flotilla seeing what's around.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You find a couple ships whose crews seem to gotten into a deadly scuffle. Free to board, you find a crate of illicit trade supplies.
ActionResult.Title: Explore the Crimson Fleet

ActionResult.FlavorText: I set in a heading for the vampiric fleet.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You are given leave to linger here, but it's suggested that you don't stay too long.
ActionResult.Title: Travel to Crimsontide

FlavorText: Amid the tapestry of stars, a gathering of marauders claim this place in the space between as their own. Their ships entwined, vampiric admirals dark and elegant, feast upon the unwary.
Name: Crimsontide

ActionResult.FlavorText: I am astounded by the sheer amount of neon light.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You disembark into the illicit Casino where most manner of thrill can be found.
ActionResult.Title: Travel to One Eyed Jacks

ActionResult.FlavorText: I explore the Casino.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: From one of the private suites in the designated hotel area you hear a series of pops. Opening the door, you see a room with a few dead mean, one clutching something tightly in his hand.
ActionResult.Title: Explore One Eyed Jacks

FlavorText: A haven for the lucky, doom for the unlucky. Jack made sure to found this Oasis far away from the desert authority.
Name: One Eyed Jacks

ActionResult.FlavorText: I see a tucked away trading station, and am given permission to land.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You disembark into a rather well maintained hangar bay, with entrances to seedier venues.
ActionResult.Title: Travel to Smugglers Nook

ActionResult.FlavorText: I search through the designated Bazaar area in search of anything that might be interesting. One dealer offers a mystery package for the price of one gold.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: I hand him some clink, and obtain the package.
ActionResult.Title: Explore Smuggler's Nook.

FlavorText: An honorable den of thieves if ever there was one. More clink passes between hands here than most would realize.
Name: Smuggler's Nook

ActionResult.FlavorText: I set sail toward one of the greater seats of mystery, with information I find my way through it's obscurance.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You are asked to touchdown in an airfield, outside of the colony's main township, thankfully the gravity is light enough so taking off won't be an terrible issue.
ActionResult.Title: Travel to Rakshasa

ActionResult.FlavorText: Aleisburg is a large town close to the size of a city. Interestingly, it's aesthetic and infrastructure feels like leaping back to the dark sword era, before the arcane unlocking.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: In an alley recycling bin, you find a child's toy.
ActionResult.Title: Exploring Rakshasa

FlavorText: Ever mysterious, this shaded and illusive planet seems capable of secreting itself away from lawful enterprise.
Name: Rakshasa

ActionResult.FlavorText: If you didn't know that this was here, you wouldn't have noticed the structure made of lacings of shadow before you.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: A patch of deeper darkness draws you within.
ActionResult.Title: Travel to Black Sun Campaign

ActionResult.FlavorText: There is nothing I could find here.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You're not even sure this place exists.
ActionResult.Title: There is no way to explore here.

FlavorText: Classified.
Name: Black Sun Campaign

ActionResult.FlavorText: I watch as the moon sized sphere enlarges as I approach, It's red water vibrates sporadically on it's surface.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: I disembark in the main observation post. And am greeted like a noble, by the Revel Meister.
ActionResult.Title: Travel to The Feast

ActionResult.FlavorText: I search the surface of the blood waters, seeing bodies of land being slowly built through the sacrifice of bone and flesh.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: I am drawn to one of the forming continents, on a beach of granulated bone, from somewhere below a dead hand stretches upward from the bonesand, it bears a dark chalice.
ActionResult.Title: Explore The Feast

FlavorText: The greatest spoils of all for the Vampiric kind are gathered thither here, a sphere of red where that sweet nectar overfloweth. But to what end?
Name: The Feast

ActionResult.FlavorText: With the letter, I'm able to enter an audience with Admiral Sascha.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: She purr's darkly upon seeing your mortal form, before handing you a symbol of Crimson bearing a black skull. If you wish to rise, plunder and take.
ActionResult.Title: Speak to Admiral Sascha

ActionResult.FlavorText: I move to engage the Flagship of the Crimsontide.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: As the Titan explodes, I hear a purr of approval and a vow of vengeance drift to me from one of the ejecting escape pods. As an immortal being, she would have reformed eventually anyways.
ActionResult.Title: Engaging the Red Cutlass

FlavorText: The dreaded piratess and captain of the Red Cutlass. Current Admiral Commanding of the Crimsontide.
Name: Admiral Sascha

ActionResult.FlavorText: I ask the High Prince if he would like to do business.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: He offers me the seal of a fallen house, a trinket he's become tired of carrying.
ActionResult.Title: An Offer of Exchange

ActionResult.FlavorText: I approach the open throneroom, to find the originator, High Prince Vladimir.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Pleased that a mortal would be so bold as to waltz into the hunter's mouth, he invites you to seek out the Crimson Fleet, should you wish to earn the right to enter the ranks of the unliving.
ActionResult.Title: Speak to the High Prince

ActionResult.FlavorText: I show proof of my worthiness to join the red and black courts.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You receive the Kiss of Lords, and find your life ended, and your unlife begun.
ActionResult.Title: Present the Unliving Mark

ActionResult.FlavorText: It's time that I dealt with the Prince of Shadow.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You strike down the Antidiluvian, he'll reform in time though.
ActionResult.Title: Unseat the Black Tyrant

FlavorText: Undisputed ruler of Nocturne, founder of The Black and Crimson Courts. Also a licensed clinical therapist.
Name: High Prince Vladimir

FlavorText: A bauble marked with the symbol of the dark star. Can grant access to a Cryo Coffin bearing the same symbol.
Name: Crypt Key

ActionResult.FlavorText: I speak to the awoken Prince.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: With a deep bow Alucard introduces himself. Pledging upon the honor of his house that he is at your service.
ActionResult.Title: An Unlikely Ally

FlavorText: A Vampire Prince, who seems to be of good disposition and humor. Blonde of hair and fair of skin, he is eternally grateful to you for having freed him.
Name: Alucard

ActionResult.FlavorText: I see a man sitting alone at the bar in One Eyed Jacks, eating a slice of cherry pie with coffee. He openly wears a badge declaring himself an investigator of Avalon.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: He grins and shakes as you sit down, wasting no time in getting to local gossip. He's here looking for evidence of a girl named Paula who went missing in Avalonian Space not too long ago. He hands you his business card as you depart.
ActionResult.Title: The Man at the Bar

ActionResult.FlavorText: Beaumont grimaces as I hand him the figurine. He wires most of the investigation's money to me in thanks.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: As you begin to leave, Beaumont whispers that there's someone else to help. One of the Knight's of Roundtable is being kept prisoner here, it would take an establishment to get him out. He hands you a spherical stone, if you're interested.
ActionResult.Title: Breaking the Bad News

ActionResult.FlavorText: Flavor text...
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Outcome text...
ActionResult.Title: A Favor for a Knight

FlavorText: An eccentric private investigator with a penchant for cherry pie and a "damn fine" cup of coffee.
Name: P.I. Beaumont

ActionResult.FlavorText: I ask the local fence about the crate of contraband. He says that the shop is a little short on coin, but he'll throw something extra in along with payment.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Along with a pouch of coin, he hands you an iou that can be redeemed at One Eyed Jacks.
ActionResult.Title: Trading the Contraband

ActionResult.FlavorText: The local fence wonders if you would want to haul "clean" goods to Yggdrasil in the Avalon System.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: After the goods are loaded onto your ship, he says that he's always looking for responsible haulers.
ActionResult.Title: A Hauling Job

FlavorText: A retired gentleman thief whose found his calling helping... well thieves. He makes an absolute fortune fencing contraband and stolen plunder.
Name: Jean

ActionResult.FlavorText: The Count does not receive guests, unless they bring something of interest to him.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: The Count receives you, thanking you for returning his grimoire to him. In return he hands you an old magical artifact which he waves off since it's magic will wear away in the next hundred years.
ActionResult.Title: Presenting the Grimoire

FlavorText: The Count is an elusive figure, mostly keeping to himself on his elusive home.
Name: Count Aleister

ActionResult.FlavorText: She welcomes me as though I were a newfound sibling, for the raising of new aristocrats are a rarified occasion these days. She has a gift delivered to your ship.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You are told about the Revel, about how even the little light that reaches it disrupts the formation of the vampiric planet. If you want to help she says to go seek out the Black Sun Campaign.
ActionResult.Title: How to aid the Revel.

FlavorText: She organizes the great revel, the terraformation project of Vampiric Kind.
Name: Revel Meister

ActionResult.FlavorText: My shadow splits from myself, creating a perfect image of black.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You are ejected back into the space between with your newfound shadow, as well as the shadow of a thought; Bring Darkness.
ActionResult.Title: The Shadow

FlavorText: A shadow enters your mind.
Name: Shade

ActionResult.FlavorText: Somehow that cacophonous din they call music reaches me through the space between. Fracking fuel sniffers.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You defeat the vermin.
ActionResult.Title: Battle the Pirate Cutter

FlavorText: Such ships are crewed by at most a handful of aspiring ghouls. They fill their purses along with their bellies.
Name: Pirate Cutter

FlavorText: Mark of the Crimson Fleet, can be exchanged for rewards at the proper authority.
Name: Crimson Mark

ActionResult.FlavorText: And I'm putting it back together again.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Oh it's a Chaingun, pew pew.
ActionResult.Title: Taking Weapon Apart

FlavorText: A battered weapons package.
Name: Junked Pattern A Arms Platform

ActionResult.FlavorText: And I'm putting it back together again.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: And all the king's horses, and all the king's men, humpty dumpty rearranged himself into a pulse laser! Zap zap.
ActionResult.Title: Taking Weapon Apart

FlavorText: A battered weapons package.
Name: Junked Pattern B Arms Platform

ActionResult.FlavorText: I suppose I'll lubricate it.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You repair a set of quintessence tubes.
ActionResult.Title: Straightening Arcane Rods

FlavorText: Some bent rods meant to be fitted into a reactor.
Name: Damaged Energy Component

ActionResult.FlavorText: I don't think this will take long.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You defeat the simpering pirate scum.
ActionResult.Title: Lighting up the Cherrybomb

FlavorText: They're called Cherrybombs because they're pretty insignificant. Which is why they tend to roam in hunting packs.
Name: Pirate Cherrybomb

ActionResult.FlavorText: Why are these manuals so hard to follow?
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You figured it out on your own, no thanks to the stupid manual.
ActionResult.Title: Putting Shelving Together

FlavorText: Destroyed standing container unit, more rust than metal.
Name: Broken Storage Locker

ActionResult.FlavorText: I can't find anything wrong with it, just work already!
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You kicked it and now it works fine.
ActionResult.Title: Kicking the Emitter

FlavorText: Supposedly some sort of energy emitter, too inconsistant to be sure what it is though.
Name: Stuttering Array

ActionResult.FlavorText: They think I'm weak, they might be right.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You defeat the enemy ship.
ActionResult.Title: Engaging the Eagle

FlavorText: A standard scout and recon vessel, likely with a few competant hands aboard.
Name: Pirate Eagle

ActionResult.FlavorText: A little bit of chaos is fine, but this thing needs reordering.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You have established order where once there chaos and decay, by the power of duct tape.
ActionResult.Title: Putting Things in Order

FlavorText: It's magic can temporarily open holes through dimensional space time, to allow for rapid transportation. It's material trapping however are corrupted.
Name: Derelict Driver

ActionResult.FlavorText: I'll see if sealant will do the trick.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You bet it did.
ActionResult.Title: Calling the Kettle Black

FlavorText: Fire should definitly not be coming out of there, or there... or there.
Name: Cracked Furnace

ActionResult.FlavorText: No wonder it's not working, the sigildry is all messed up.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: And there you go, they're spinning!
ActionResult.Title: Painting the Proper Sigils

FlavorText: Wizards really like these spinny things for some reason, too bad this one's out of commission at the moment.
Name: Archaic Gyros

ActionResult.FlavorText: Flavor text...
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Outcome text...
ActionResult.Title: Explore Glint

FlavorText: Perhaps the most mineral rich sector in known space. The dwarves wasted no time with attempts to exploit their whole of their home. Wealth is the rule here.
Name: Glint

FlavorText: Flavor text...
Name: Boulderhearth

ActionResult.FlavorText: I flip through the pages of the black book.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You're unable to understand most of the content within the strange book. But you do discover the location of a hidden planet in the Nocturne system.
ActionResult.Title: Read the Grimoire

FlavorText: A mysterious tome, found in the undercroft of Dracule.
Name: Grimoire

ActionResult.FlavorText: I drip the vital essence onto the mark.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: It greedily devours the crimson liquid, growing in size and brutal beauty.
ActionResult.Title: Feed the Mark

ActionResult.FlavorText: I listen intently to the quiet crashing of Tide.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You discover that it wasn't so quiet after all.
ActionResult.Title: The Crimson Calls

FlavorText: A mark made from blood gold, complete it's power to prove that you are worthy.
Name: Mark Of Tide

FlavorText: This should give you safe passage in the Crimsontide, as well as an audience with the Red Admiral.
Name: Letter Of Introduction

FlavorText: Proof of Victory over Admiral Sascha.
Name: Feathered Tricorn

FlavorText: Blood of the Night. The origin calls.
Name: Bloodfather Vial

FlavorText: The ship of Alucard, the last piece of a once powerful House of the Black Court.
Name: Darkstar

ActionResult.FlavorText: It's not difficult for me to hear it's cry of vengeance now.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: The next victim has been marked for harvest, it seeks the strong.
ActionResult.Title: Listen to the Tide

ActionResult.FlavorText: I drip the blood of heroes onto the mark.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: The Mark's Hunger has been satisfied. It's Hunger is ready to be taken on now, without the guarantee of death... well... in a way at least.
ActionResult.Title: Feed the Mark

FlavorText: A symbol of the Crimsontide, this one has been nourished and grows in power.
Name: Vibrant Tidemark

FlavorText: The essence of a son of the stars, solidified in death, when the forced resignation of cold nothingness found it's way in.
Name: Quickened Vitalus

ActionResult.FlavorText: I loose the dogs of war against the unsuspecting and the vulnerable.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: As one of the strong, you take your rightful plunder.
ActionResult.Title: Fly with the Red Flotilla

FlavorText: Join the Crimsontide in raids against the enemies of night.
Name: Piracy

FlavorText: The Mark bids you destroy a certain scout ship, it floods you with a sense of urgency, guiding you towards the stars of Avalon.
Name: Horizon Contract

FlavorText: The Mark bids an act of distinction, it's own hesitation is worrisome.
Name: Lancelot Contract

FlavorText: Bring this before the High Prince, and he will show you the path to unlightenment.
Name: Unliving Mark

FlavorText: The blood of heroes.
Name: Fortified Vitalus

FlavorText: Hail to you who bear this mark, the mark of the princes of unlife.
Name: Kiss Of Undeath

ActionResult.FlavorText: I have the crates opened.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You've been given armament befitting of one of the Aristocratic class.
ActionResult.Title: Vladimir's Gift

FlavorText: A Package left in your cargo hold from the Prince, welcoming you to the aristocracy.
Name: A Princely Gift

FlavorText: Illegal recreational supplies.
Name: Crate Of Contraband

ActionResult.FlavorText: Acquiring the contents of the first package.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Some decent equipment of more standard quality fit for civilian use.
ActionResult.Title: Acquiring Hardware

FlavorText: Half of the components you would need to craft a frigate.
Name: Wb Frigate Package A

ActionResult.FlavorText: Opening the second package.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: The rest of the components you would need to craft a frigate.
ActionResult.Title: Acquiring Hardware

FlavorText: The other half of the components you would need to craft a frigate.
Name: Wb Frigate Package B

ActionResult.FlavorText: I open the package.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: An old musty smelling shoe greets me, this thing might be a biohazard. The packing itself though displays an advertisement for a location in the Nocturne System.
ActionResult.Title: What could be inside?

FlavorText: The mystery package I bought from the dealer in the bazaar.
Name: Mystery Package

FlavorText: A detailed figure of a knight on horseback, such figures haven't been seen since the age of yore. It's highly articulated, the words "To Paula" have been lazered onto the horses underside.
Name: Knight Figurine

FlavorText: Remain unseen in even the most secure of locations.
Name: Cloak Of Invisibility

FlavorText: An letter of promise to return a favor, can be redeemed at One Eyed Jacks.
Name: Jacks Iou

FlavorText: A large crate of trade goods, meant to be delivered to the Avalon's Trade Authority on Yggdrasil.
Name: Laundered Trade Goods

FlavorText: The business card of Investigator Beaumont, he was searching for a girl named Paula.
Name: Business Card

FlavorText: A paired communications stone, Beaumont was wanting to free a knight of Roundtable from One Eyed Jacks. It would take a favor.
Name: Comms Stone

ActionResult.FlavorText: I am taken aback as a Knight of Roundtable bends the knee and pleges his loyalties to me.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You are even more taken aback when a destroyer is brought to him.
ActionResult.Title: Galahad Pledges Himself

FlavorText: The chaste knight of Roundtable is an experienced adventurer, a stoic ascetic who is known for his valor since the age of yore.
Name: Sir Galahad

FlavorText: The questing ship of Galahad, it has served him well over the years.
Name: Pilgrim

FlavorText: A mysterious poker chip, thrums withs arcane energy.
Name: Mystic Chip

ActionResult.FlavorText: I return the blood of Origin back to it's place.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: The cup that first brought unlife to the universe. To the vampiric this cup represents ascension, to most others a danger. What should be done?
ActionResult.Title: Returning the Origin

FlavorText: A darkened cup, that calls for blood.
Name: Chalice Of Origin

ActionResult.FlavorText: I drink deeply from the cup.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You ascend to true immortality. Hail to you, King of Night.
ActionResult.Title: Ascend

FlavorText: What shall be done with it?
Name: Cup Of Unlife

FlavorText: Hail to you, King of Night.
Name: Strength Of Night

ActionResult.FlavorText: Everything you should need to conquer.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Time to build a ship.
ActionResult.Title: The Ship makes the Aristocrat

FlavorText: Everything required to raise a new Aristocrat to a fitting state.
Name: Gift Of Revel

FlavorText: Nothingness, it's dread inducing.
Name: Nothingness

FlavorText: It is your Shadow.
Name: Shadow

FlavorText: You must figure out how to bring eternal dark to this place.
Name: Bring Darkness

ActionResult.FlavorText: Flavor text...
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Outcome text...
ActionResult.Title: Explore Avalon

FlavorText: Governed by the Order of Roundtable, the knights of humanity sail forth. With honor and friendship Avalon, is indeed the jewel of the stars.
Name: Avalon

ActionResult.FlavorText: I gaze at Roundtable Station, the nexus of Avalon. To date it's the single largest office structure in the known universe.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You are cleared to enter a docking bay.
ActionResult.Title: Travel to Roundtable Nexus

ActionResult.FlavorText: Flavor text...
ActionResult.OutcomeText: Outcome text...
ActionResult.Title: Explore Roundtable Nexus

FlavorText: The symbol of humanity's militaristic and adminstrative power. This is the seat of the Order of Roundtable, as well as where King Arthur rules from.
Name: Roundtable Nexus

FlavorText: The cradle of humanity, Earth is renowned for the production of the majority of organically based products in the known galaxy.
Name: Earth

FlavorText: It's said that Merlin planted a great tree, but until the terraformation projects investigated the ice giants, nobody knew where it was. Yggdrasil the great tree stretches easily outside of it's planetary atmosphere, acting as a natural space elevator, and economic hub for the Avalon System.
Name: Yggdrasil

FlavorText: A towering multi level defensive complex with an extended shipyard, built atop the earth's moon. It is bulwark that defends humanity.
Name: The Citadel

FlavorText: In this long expanse of the emptiness between a shuttle slowly sails, silent and unassuming.
Name: Terminus Est

FlavorText: Following the first Merlin's example, the A.M.S. White Lodge is a monastic carrier vessel, meant to cloister the monks and magi within from the bustle of the galaxy outside.
Name: White Lodge

FlavorText: Avalon's primary source of materia based fuel and a rich fountain of quintessence, the only problem is that both resources are sourced from... dragons.
Name: Dragonroost

FlavorText: Between Mars and Jupiter exists a metal rich ring of asteroids, at which a stationary mining colony has been built to extract those resources. The Leviathan Belt is responsible for nearly all resources used in the construction of ships both civilian and military in the Avalon System.
Name: Leviathan Belt

FlavorText: The Crown and Scepter of Avalon. He united humanity in the days of the dark sword, and lived during the age of Yore. No man is as venerable as he.
Name: King Arthur

FlavorText: The Sword of the stars who has held the line for a millennium against the threats of Avalon.
Name: Sir Lancelot

ActionResult.FlavorText: I move to engage the Flagship of the Crimsontide.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: As the Titan explodes, I hear a purr of approval and a vow of vengeance drift to me from one of the ejecting escape pods.
ActionResult.Title: Engaging the Red Cutlass

ActionResult.FlavorText: It's time that I dealt with the Prince of Shadow.
ActionResult.OutcomeText: You strike down the Antidiluvian, he'll reform in time though.
ActionResult.Title: Unseat the Black Tyrant
